intro: Rinorea wallichiana, commonly known as the Himalayan velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Nepal, India, and Bhutan. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its soft, velvety foliage. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are palmately lobed and emit a distinctive, pleasant fragrance, especially when crushed. The flowers are small, yellowish-green, and clustered in terminal panicles, blooming during the summer months.
